page.title: 11PORTHCAWL-Fishing
page.content: Having first checked the times of the tides in the local paper,I decided to see what I could catch in the way of supper for that night.My first visit was to the Porthcawl Angling Centre at Dock St.to buy my bait.I positioned myself halfway along the pier,a high tide surrounded me on both sides.I had brought with me my rod,25lb breaking strain line,my fixed spool reel,which I always use a nd my tackle box.In this I carry hooks,weights,swivels, booms,beads,muppets,traces,floats and a knife.Having cast out I wondered would it be mackerel,flounder,or ray. After only a momentary wait a tug at the line proved to be a pair of mackerel,the sea's easiest fish to catch.Supper would be tasty tonight.
